description.narrative: The intervention aims to mainstream LGBTI rights in Turkey by way of:i. capacity development of professionals and LGBTI organizations working on LGBTI issues;ii. enhancing the visibility of LGBTI issues on mainstream media by way of training journalists, producing responsible news and analyzing media trends on the issue andiii. awareness raising of key stakeholders and responsible institutions through networking opportunities, enriching the literature and human rights reporting on the topic as well as lobbying activities

KAOS GL (här efter KAOS) har ansökt om stöd från Sida för att genomföra projektet ”The Rainbow Project 2017-2020” om 13 852 422 SEK.
Insatsen syftar till att minska diskriminering gentemot HBTQ-personer i det turkiska samhället genom en rad aktiviteter så som att; förändra allmänhetens perception av HBTQ-personer genom ansvarstagande medial rapportering; påverka offentlig och privat sektor i sitt förhållningssätt vis-a-vis anställda HBTQ-personer; öka kapaciteteten för de icke-statliga organisationer som arbetar för HBTQ-rättigheter samt för de individer som i sin profession bistår HBTQ-personer (t.ex. advokater, socialarbetare och psykologer); bedriva påverkansarbete gentemot beslutsfattare på nationell och internationell nivå för HBTQ-medveten lagstiftning; förbättrad övervakning av brott mot mänskliga rättigheter för HBTQ-personer; samt bistå HBTQ-personer med samtalsstöd.
Utvecklingsinsatsens totala budget är 13 852 422 SEK och finansieras i sin helhet av Sida. 2 252 521 SEK av insatsens budget är avsatta för vidareförmedling till KAOS implementerande partner i projektet, organisationen Black Pink Triangel (BPT).

The intervention will try to address wide-spread discrimination against LGBTI individuals in Turkish society through various channels involving changing public perceptions by way of responsible reporting in mainstream media, influencing public and private sector in their practices vis-a-vis LGBTI employees, increasing the capacities of NGOs working for the rights of LGBTIs as well as professionals who give services to LGBTI individuals (lawyers, social workers, pyschiatric personnel), lobbying for LGBTI sensitive legislation vis-a-vis decision makers at national and international level, better monitoring of human rights violations of LGBTI individuals and providing consultancy for LGBTI individuals.

participating-org.narrative: Kaos Gay and Lesbian Cultural Research and Solidarity Association
Kaos Gay and Lesbian Cultural Research and Solidarity Association

tag.narrative: 1.5 - By 2030, build the resilience of the poor and those in vulnerable situations and reduce their exposure and vulnerability to climate-related extreme events and other economic, social and environmental shocks and disasters.

1.5 - Till 2030 bygga upp motståndskraften hos de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer och minska deras utsatthet och sårbarhet för extrema klimatrelaterade händelser och andra ekonomiska, sociala och miljömässiga chocker och katastrofer.
10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.

10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Outcome 1: Kaos is carrying out its work on making LGBTI people and rights visible by producing news and disseminating through its publications, website and social media accounts. Utmost care is taken on visibility as the association operates in a difficult environment. Media school to train local journalists and raise awareness on LGBTI rights and right based reporting is carried out. Kaos will be working on their communication strategy. Outcome 2: Due to the current political barriers, Kaos GL and other LGBTI rights organisations cannot involve in the making and implementation of human rights policies and legislation at national level. This means the organization deliberately moved away from working with duty bearers to strengthening key stakeholders from strategically targeted such as: active citizens, rights-based media, mainstream media, academia and university students, municipalities, CSOs including LGBTI organisations and bar associations. Kaos has focused on capacity building of stakeholders that are willing to work on LGBTI rights especially municipalities. Advocacy and lobbying activities is currently on hold. Outcome 3: Capacities of LGBTIs, their NGOs, allies and key stakeholders were increased in protecting and promoting human rights of LGBTIs. Kaos is the biggest LGBTI organization and has established good relations with key stakeholders. It supplies small grants programs and counselling and development capacity support to local LGBTI NGOs which do not have adequate capacity to run a grant but which need small funding to carry out events. Kaos currently is focused more on keeping and practicing the attained rights more than achieving new ones.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
